author: big_tech_sux
content: i mean maybe it's worth doing a mainnet contract search, to see how many contracts would actually be broken by new instructions with immediates

author: jwasinger
content: it might be nontrivial to prove that a contract isn't affected.  it has to be impossible for a dynamic jump to move execution into the immediate data.  I would guess there are contracts where it is impossible to determine this statically (depending on the byte chosen for the new opcode).

author: big_tech_sux
content: yea i mean i agree that it's intractable in general, but i think what <@707066320243654737> was pointing out is that we may be able to do a "good enough" job on mainnet -- and the only way to really find out is by trying
